Number of patients aged 18 years or over, not on the QOF Hypertension Register as of 31 March 2023, and who have (i) a last recorded blood pressure reading in the 3 years prior to 1 April 2023 >= 140/90mmHg with the exception of patients whose first blood pressure reading >= 140/90mmHg in this period is on or after 1 October 2022 OR (ii) a blood pressure reading >= 140/90mmHg on or after 1 October 2022.
Of the denominator, the number for whom there is evidence of clinically appropriate follow-up to confirm or exclude a diagnosis of hypertension.

Of the denominator, the number for whom there is evidence of clinically appropriate follow-up* to confirm or exclude a diagnosis of hypertension (by 31 March for (i) and within 6 months for (ii)). Clinically appropriate follow-up: 1. Initial BP reading < 140/90 mmHg (only relevant for patients in (i)) OR 2. Initial BP reading >=140/90 mmHg AND a. Subsequent change of medication AND subsequent blood pressure reading of <140/90 mmHg OR b. Subsequent occurrence of Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring OR c. Subsequent occurrence of Home Blood Pressure Monitoring OR d. ([Referrals listed in below table] recorded on same day as initial reading AND addition to QOF Hypertension Register) OR e. (Subsequent commencement of Antihypertensive therapy OR Patient declined antihypertensive treatment (ANTIHYPDEC_COD code cluster)) AND addition to QOF Hypertension Register

Total number of patients using potentially addictive medicines, defined as patients falling into either one or both of the following sub-cohorts: Patients with 2 or more prescriptions over a 3-month* period (both of which must have occurred after the quality service start date) for any of the following four classes of medicine:a.Gabapentinoids b.Benzodiazepines c. Z-drugs d. Any oral or transdermal opioid other than: i. Weak opioids (Codeine, Dihydrocodeine, Meptazinol) ii. Heroin substitutes (including Methadone, Buprenorphine) e. EXCLUSION: any opioid prescribed to cancer patients (patients with a cancer diagnosis recorded in the previous 6 months, irrespective of whether this diagnosis is a first/new occurrence, a recurrence, or continuing condition) Patients with a single prescription for an oral or transdermal opioid with > 120 mg morphine equivalent.

Number of men aged 50 years or over and women aged 55 years or over, without established cardiovascular disease and not on lipid lowering therapy*. *lipid lower therapy means people who have received a prescription for any of the below medications  in the 6 months upto and including the QSSD statins, ezetimibe, bempedoic acid, inclisiran, PCSK9i, or icosapent ethyl. [NOTE: this list includes lipid lowering therapies used for secondary prevention, so is a longer list than that used for CVD-08 which only uses therapies used for primary prevention]

Clinically unsuitable is defined as (no ordering between these options - evaluate all simultaneously): Patients who have a persisting statin contraindication anywhere in the patient record. OR Patients who have an expiring statin contraindication in the 12 months to PPED OR413174003 Statin not tolerated (situation). Statin declined should be expiring in the 12 months to PPED

Number of patients on the QOF Asthma Register at the end of the reporting period.
Of the denominator, the number who received three or more inhaled corticosteroid (ICS, inclusive of ICS/LABA) prescriptions over the previous 12 months.
Number of patients on the QOF Asthma Register at the end of the reporting period.
Of the denominator, the number receiving 6 or more Short Acting Beta-2 Agonist (SABA) inhaler prescription items (not quantity) in the previous 12 months.
Of the denominator, the number who received a Structured Medication Review on or after QSSD and up to and including RPED.
Total number of patients at risk of harm due to medication errors.
Of the denominator, the number who received a Structured Medication Review on or after QSSD and up to and including RPED.
Total number of patients recorded on the GP system as living with severe frailty
Number of patients on the QOF Learning Disability register aged 14 years or over.
Of the denominator, the number who received an annual Learning Disability Health Check and a Health Action Plan by the end of the reporting period.
Of the denominator, the number of patients who received a Structured Medication Review on or after QSSD and up to and including RPED.

Total number of patients using potentially addictive medicines, defined as patients falling into either one or both of the following sub-cohorts: 1.Patients with 2 or more prescriptions over a 3-month* period (both of which must have occurred after the quality service start date) for any of the following four classes of medicine: a.Gabapentinoids. b.Benzodiazepines. c.Z-drugs. d.Any oral or transdermal opioid other than:i.Weak opioids (Codeine, Dihydrocodeine, Meptazinol).ii.Heroin substitutes (including Methadone, Buprenorphine). 2.Patients with a single prescription for an oral or transdermal opioid with > 120 mg morphine equivalent
Number of permanent care home residents aged 18 years or over (patients recorded as living in a residential home or nursing home and not subsequently recorded as being temporary care home residents).
Of the denominator, the number of patients who received at least one Structured Medication Review by the end of the reporting period
Mean number of patient contacts as part of weekly care home round per care home resident aged 18 years or over
Number of patients aged 18 years or over recorded as living in a care home (GPES).
Number of patients aged 65 years or over.
Of the denominator, the number who received a seasonal influenza vaccination between 1 September and 31 March and by the end of the reporting period.
Of the denominator, the number with a recording of ethnicity on their patient record at the end of the reporting period.
Number of patients on the QOF Coronary Heart Disease, Peripheral Arterial Disease, or Stroke/TIA Register

Of the denominator, the number who have a recording of non-HDL cholesterol in the preceding 12 months that is lower than 2.5 mmol/L or where non-HDL cholesterol is not recorded then a recording of LDL cholesterol in the preceding 12 months that is lower than 1.8 mmol/L. NB the numerator should not include people with no recorded non-HDL or LDL cholesterol in the preceding 12 months
Number of patients aged 18 years or over recorded as living in a care home.
Patient age is less than 18 years at the quality service end date.
Patients whose latest housing status was not recorded as a permanent resident in a residential or nursing home or temporary resident in a care home, up to and including the achievement date.
Patients who have the registration with general practitioner practice aligned to care home declined code, recorded up to and including the achievement date.
